title: 2020 Annual Report
body: Helios Quantum Computing launched its first scalable superconducting quantum processor prototype in 2020, achieving $8.2 million in revenue and advancing its IP portfolio with key patents focused on quantum-classical hybrid architectures. Risk factors include manufacturing scale-up and export controls. ESG goals focus on clean manufacturing and diversity.

title: 2021 Annual Report
body: Revenue and margin growth continued with the release of QuantaOS, a hybrid operating system improving quantum-classical workloads. The company strengthened R&D capabilities and expanded international sales, notably in Europe and Asia.

title: 2022 Annual Report
body: The FDA breakthrough designation for quantum clinical software opened accelerated US market access. Partnerships with national labs enhanced computational chemistry projects. Focus remained on scaling quantum hardware and software production.

title: 2023 Annual Report
body: Revenue rose amid industry challenges with reputational vigilance and expanded product releases. Strategic government and academic collaborations bolstered positioning.

title: 2024 Annual Report
body: The company grew with new product certifications and client wins, strengthened IP through new patents, maintained sustainability commitments, and formed the Tri-Forge joint venture with cloud and AI software partners.

title: Q2 2025 Earnings
body: EPS rose 12% year-over-year with ARR reaching $80 million. Financial guidance was raised amid strong pipeline growth and strategic partnerships.

title: Tri-Forge Joint Venture
body: Helios Quantum Computing announced a joint venture with Borealis CloudWorks and QuantumQuill Software, combining quantum hardware, cloud computing, and AI to accelerate industrial applications.

title: New Quantum Error Correction Patents
body: Filed five patents outlining novel quantum error correction mechanisms enabling scalable and fault-tolerant quantum computing hardware.

title: DOE Quantum Research Grant Award
body: Department of Energy awarded $3 million research grant for quantum algorithm development focusing on computational chemistry and materials science applications.

title: Superconducting Qubit Architecture Patent
body: Patent US10,987,654 granted for breakthrough superconducting qubit architecture enabling scalable quantum processor design with improved coherence times and reduced error rates.

title: Series B Funding Round $35 Million
body: Series B funding completed raising $35 million led by quantum-focused venture capital firms. Funding supports hardware scaling, software development, and market expansion initiatives.

title: Quantum Software Simulator FDA Certification
body: FDA certification achieved for Quantum Sim Suite enabling use in clinical research and pharmaceutical development. Certification covers drug discovery simulations and molecular modeling applications.

title: National Labs Quantum Chemistry Partnership
body: Strategic partnership with national laboratories for quantum computational chemistry research. Collaboration includes joint research projects, shared computing resources, and co-development of quantum algorithms.

title: PharmaGen Quantum Computing Services
body: Multi-year contract with PharmaGen for quantum computing services supporting clinical AI and drug discovery applications. Contract value $5 million annually with expansion options.

title: 100-Qubit Quantum Processor Achievement
body: Successfully demonstrated stable operation of 100-qubit quantum processor with industry-leading coherence times and gate fidelities. Milestone represents significant advancement in quantum hardware scaling.

title: DARPA Quantum Defense Applications
body: $8 million DARPA contract for quantum computing applications in defense and national security. Project focuses on quantum optimization algorithms and secure quantum communication protocols.

title: Quantum Cloud Platform Launch
body: Commercial launch of Quantum Cloud Platform providing quantum computing as a service. Platform offers access to quantum processors, simulation tools, and algorithm development environments.

title: Quantum Advantage Research Paper
body: Published breakthrough research in Nature demonstrating quantum computational advantage for optimization problems. Research validates commercial quantum computing applications and establishes scientific credibility.

title: Intel Quantum Hardware Collaboration
body: Expanded partnership with Intel Quantum for quantum processor manufacturing and development. Collaboration provides access to advanced fabrication capabilities and manufacturing expertise.

title: $80M Revenue Run-Rate Achievement
body: Achieved $80 million annual revenue run-rate milestone reflecting strong commercial traction and successful market expansion. Milestone validates business model and growth strategy execution.
